0.text:
Chances are you live in a relatively safe
and secure place, but there are some places

4.text:
out there where life expectancy is irrelevant
as it could be taken from you any day. If

10.text:
you’re planning your next holiday, you should
strongly consider skipping all of these places.

14.text:
From drug gangs to homicides to terrorism,
we count 10 of the most dangerous cities in

22.text:
10. Ciudad Juarez, Mexico
Mexico is well known for drug trafficking,

30.text:
and Ciudad Juarez has been one of the nation’s
most violent cities. Police are often employed

35.text:
or paid off by drug gangs resulting in hundreds
if not thousand crimes going unsolved every

41.text:
year. However this has been improving in recent
years and murders are down from 3,111 in 2010

47.text:
to 730 in 2012. While these numbers are still
very scary, hopefully it shows a road to recovery

60.text:
The capital of Venezuela, Caracas is currently
facing a very serious crisis involving drug

66.text:
gangs. Crime rate in general including muggings
and theft is also very high, making this an

72.text:
undesirable location for tourism. Since the
election of current president Hugo Chavez

77.text:
in 1998, murder rates have more than doubled
and in 2008 Caracas won the award for “Murder

84.text:
Capital of the World” by Foreign Policy.
I’m not so sure there should be an award

88.text:
for such a thing myself, but this shows how
serious the problem in Caracas really is.

94.text:
8. Cape Town, South Africa
While South Africa is a tourism magnet due

100.text:
to it’s natural beauty and close proximity
to nature preserves and other attractions,

105.text:
Cape Town can be a very dangerous city at
the moment. A high level of poverty around

110.text:
some sections is responsible for an extremely
high crime rate, and many tourists go there

115.text:
and never return. However, it is possible
to visit Cape Town as long as you avoid the

120.text:
more dangerous sections and don’t travel
alone at night.

124.text:
7. Guatemala City, Guatemala
Guatemala is a nation located in the Caribbean

131.text:
and it has many tourist attractions, Guatemala
City is unfortunately not one of them. The

136.text:
city is plagued with drug violence and has
a high murder rate, along with many robberies,

141.text:
carjackings and bus holdups. It’s advisable
to stay away from this city if you’re thinking

145.text:
of visiting Guatemala, or if you must visit,
precautions should be taken such as not travelling

150.text:
in the dark, keeping valuables to a minimum
and avoiding buses if possible.

156.text:
6. Acapulco, Mexico
Not long ago this city was considered a safe

162.text:
and luxurious resort area. However, since
then drug violence has transformed this into

167.text:
a very dangerous area indeed. Statistically,
Acapulco holds one of the world’s highest

172.text:
murder rates with 142 murders per 100,000
people. Visitors of this city are advised

178.text:
to stay on the property of the resorts they’re
visiting, as a majority of the crime occurs

184.text:
5. Baghdad, Iraq
Iraq has been on the “Do Not Travel” list

191.text:
for Americans for many years now, and it’s
not looking like that’s going to change

195.text:
any time soon. Bombings, gunfire and unpredictable
outbreaks of terrorism make this one of the

200.text:
most dangerous cities in the world. The future
of Iraq as a nation is currently very uncertain,

206.text:
with US troops departing from the country,
and for the foreseeable future, this is not

210.text:
a city anyone should visit without a good
reason.

214.text:
4. Kabul, Afghanistan
Kabul is in a very similar situation to Baghdad

220.text:
at the moment. Violence and terrorism can
occur at any time, and this is likely to be

224.text:
a dangerous place for quite a while. Currently
it’s still a war zone, though US troops

229.text:
are slowly being removed from the country.
Terrorist attacks, including bombings are

233.text:
still very common. If you’re looking to
visit Afghanistan in the near future, Kabul

238.text:
may be a city to avoid.
3. San Pedro Sula, Honduras

243.text:
A mortician from San Pedro told The Guardian
“Satan Himself lives here in San Pedro”

249.text:
With a murder rate of 187 per 100,000 people,
San Pedro Sula was named the world’s most

254.text:
violent city by a study made in Mexico in
2014. Arms and drug trafficking have flooded

260.text:
the country, contributing to an increasingly
high level of gang violence. This is further

265.text:
made worse by civilians being able to legally
own up to five personal firearms, along with

270.text:
corruption and poverty throughout the city
this doesn’t make for a peaceful life. Furthermore,

276.text:
inmates have controlled all 24 prisons in
Honduras since the government gave up on rehabilitating

286.text:
Pakistan is experiencing a great deal of political
unrest, with assassinations, suicide bombings

292.text:
and gang warfare, Karachi is one of the centres
of the violence in the country and tourists

296.text:
are advised to avoid this city. Karachi is
the largest city in Pakistan and is home to

301.text:
around 23 million people making it the second
largest city by population in the world. While

307.text:
its murder rate is not as high as many of
the other spots on this list, Karachi is the

312.text:
most dangerous of the world’s largest cities,
none of the other 13 largest cities in the

316.text:
world come close to Karachi’s murder rate.
1. Mosul - Iraq

323.text:
In June 2014, Mosul was overtaken by the Islamic
State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIS). Since

329.text:
then, Mosul has been arguably the most dangerous
city in the world, with car bombings, suicide

334.text:
bombings, assassinations and random shootings.
In August 2014 the Mosul Dam was captured

340.text:
by ISIS militants, which became a serious
concern as the destruction of the Dam would

345.text:
result in a 66ft wave of water which would’ve
destroyed Mosul and other towns nearby. Fortunately

351.text:
the Dam was re-captured by Iraqi and Kurdish
forces and is now back in safe hands, but

357.text:
regardless, Mosul in its current state is
a place you definitely don’t want to visit.
